image1.alt: Man sitting outside on a backyard patio talking and laughing with a group of friends..

content.text1: When’s the last time someone asked you what you believe? You know—about the big things in life. We’re a church that loves to ask questions, and loves people with questions. We don’t have all the answers, but exploring together is pretty much our favourite thing.

image1.alt: Three friends hanging out and walking together in the city.
Three friends standing together and chatting at a street corner in the city.
A woman smiling, sitting at a table, and looking at Home Church notes, while two other friends who are also with her at the table talk and ask questions.
A large group of people hanging out together in an open concept living room for Home Church.
Several groups of people chatting in a living room.
Three people talking over an open bible at Home Church.
Three men sitting on a couch and talking.

content.text1: Something really good happens when we gather in our neighbourhoods to share life, grow deeper spiritual friendships, and talk about how we can live Jesus-centred lives, all while we invite others to join us.

image1.alt: Friends hanging out together and playing music at a campfire.
A young woman is talking to her friends in the church lobby.

content.text2: No need to take big leaps. Drop your email below and we'll send you some of our favourite content and suggest some small next steps you can take.

content.text1: Overseers are a group of Elders selected to represent and oversee our entire ministry. Our senior staff report to this team. The Overseers focus on our vision and values while also ensuring we are financially responsible according to charitable law and are healthy and growing as a community. You can reach them at overseers@themeetinghouse.com.
We want to use our money, time, and resources to love and serve people on the margins.
Short videos that are a great starting point if you are interested in some of the basics when it comes to Jesus, God, and spirituality.
Explore the life and teaching of Jesus as well as practical applications for your daily life.

list.title: Sunday Teaching
list.text: All of our teaching videos and series, including notes, questions, audio, and additional content. Check out what we're learning, or find what you're looking for in our video playlists.
list.imageAlt: Young woman sitting at a table and looking at her notes from Sunday teaching at The Meeting House.

list.title: Livestream
list.text: We're live every Sunday at 10:00am EDT. A one hour livestream experience with stories, music, and teaching. If you're looking for a good first step, this is it. See you this Sunday!
list.imageAlt: Screen shot of Jimmy teaching during Sunday morning livestream at The Meeting House.

list.title: Podcasts
list.text: All of our Sunday teaching in one place. We've also got The After Party podcast where we chat with special guests about theology and culture and The Roundtable podcast where we discuss church life with our leaders, staff, and special guests.
list.imageAlt: Team of pastors from The Meeting House sitting around a table and recording a podcast.

list.title: Kids & Youth Curriculum
list.text: Through Sunday morning teaching, midweek group resources, and The Parent Blog, our kids and youth curriculum is designed to partner with parents and leaders and equip them with resources to disciple their kids and youth well.
list.imageAlt: Kids gathering around a smartphone to watch a video from The Meeting House Kids and Youth curriculum.

content.text1: The Hebrew Bible (or Old Testament, written hundreds of years before Jesus) prophesied a time when God would bust through the boundaries of religion and dwell intimately with humankind.

list.question: Jeremiah 31:31-34
answer: 31 “The days are coming,” declares the Lord, “when I will make a new covenant with the people of Israel and with the people of Judah. 32 It will not be like the covenant I made with their ancestors when I took them by the hand to lead them out of Egypt, because they broke my covenant, though I was a husband to them,” declares the Lord. 33 “This is the covenant I will make with the people of Israel after that time,” declares the Lord. “I will put my law in their minds and write it on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people. 34 No longer will they teach their neighbor, or say to one another, ‘Know the Lord,’ because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest,” declares the Lord. “For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.”

list.question: Ezekiel 36:25-27
answer: 25 I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your impurities and from all your idols. 26 I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit in you; I will remove from you your heart of stone and give you a heart of flesh. 27 And I will put my Spirit in you and move you to follow my decrees and be careful to keep my laws.

list.question: Joel 2:28-29
answer: 28 “And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will dream dreams, your young men will see visions. 29 Even on my servants, both men and women, I will pour out my Spirit in those days.

list.title: Jesus’s coming began the fulfilment of many prophecies, and started a “New Covenant” or new way of living in relationship with God and with others.

list.question: Luke 22:20
answer: 20 In the same way, after the supper he took the cup, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

list.question: 2 Corinthians 3:6
answer: 6 He has made us competent as ministers of a new covenant—not of the letter but of the Spirit; for the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life.

list.question: John 1:1-18
answer: 1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. 2 He was with God in the beginning. 3 Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made. 4 In him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind. 5 The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it. 6 There was a man sent from God whose name was John. 7 He came as a witness to testify concerning that light, so that through him all might believe. 8 He himself was not the light; he came only as a witness to the light. 9 The true light that gives light to everyone was coming into the world. 10 He was in the world, and though the world was made through him, the world did not recognize him. 11 He came to that which was his own, but his own did not receive him. 12 Yet to all who did receive him, to those who believed in his name, he gave the right to become children of God— 13 children born not of natural descent, nor of human decision or a husband’s will, but born of God. 14 The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth. 15 (John testified concerning him. He cried out, saying, “This is the one I spoke about when I said, ‘He who comes after me has surpassed me because he was before me.’”) 16 Out of his fullness we have all received grace in place of grace already given. 17 For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ. 18 No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made him known.

list.question: John 5:37-40
answer: 37 And the Father who sent me has himself testified concerning me. You have never heard his voice nor seen his form, 38 nor does his word dwell in you, for you do not believe the one he sent. 39 You study the Scriptures diligently because you think that in them you have eternal life. These are the very Scriptures that testify about me, 40 yet you refuse to come to me to have life.

list.question: Colossians 1:21-23
answer: 21 Once you were alienated from God and were enemies in your minds because of your evil behavior. 22 But now he has reconciled you by Christ’s physical body through death to present you holy in his sight, without blemish and free from accusation— 23 if you continue in your faith, established and firm, and do not move from the hope held out in the gospel. This is the gospel that you heard and that has been proclaimed to every creature under heaven, and of which I, Paul, have become a servant.

list.title: In his life, death, and teachings, Jesus—and only Jesus—gives us a clear and unmistakable demonstration that God is really with us and for us.

list.question: Matthew 1:23;
answer: 23 “The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel” (which means “God with us”).

list.question: Luke 23:34
answer: 34 Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
34 Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
34 Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.
34 Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” And they divided up his clothes by casting lots.

list.question: John 13:1-5
answer: 13 It was just before the Passover Festival. Jesus knew that the hour had come for him to leave this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end. 2 The evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already prompted Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus. 3 Jesus knew that the Father had put all things under his power, and that he had come from God and was returning to God; 4 so he got up from the meal, took off his outer clothing, and wrapped a towel around his waist. 5 After that, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet, drying them with the towel that was wrapped around him.

list.title: Because we know that God is with us, for us, and not against us, we can come home to him like the prodigal son (Luke 15) with confidence and bold joy.

list.question: Hebrews 4:16
answer: 16 Let us then approach God’s throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

list.title: Create a Fundraiser
list.text: Click here to start your own fundraiser for peacemakers.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words create a fundraiser.

list.title: Silent Auction
list.text: Communities from all over have donated some great items for our online silent auction!
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words silence auction.

list.title: Oakville BFG Book Sale
list.text: Looking for something new to read? Come by our used book sale on Sunday May 22 before and after the 9:30am service in Oakville.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Oakville BFG book sale.

list.title: Downtown Hamilton The Art Peace
list.text: Join the downtown Hamilton community for a fun night of wine, cheese, and art.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Downtown Hamilton The Art Peace.

list.title: Oakville Peace Wreaths
list.text: We invite you to participate in our Peacemakers Raffle! For a donation of 3$ you can win one of 3 handcrafted spring wreathes.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Oakville Peace Wreaths.

list.title: Ottawa Scone Baking
list.text: Join April when she goes live on The Meeting House Ottawa's Facebook page to share all her scone-related tips and tricks. Get a tasty treat for your troubles. Suggested donation: $5 per viewer.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Ottawa Scone Baking.

list.title: Ottawa Knitting with Jasmine
list.text: Jasmine Duckworth has kindly offered to teach us some knitting. Join us on Sunday, May 29 before church in Ottawa to learn to knit a dishcloth, repair your own knitwear, or drop something off to be repaired by Jasmine's expert hands.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Ottawa Knitting with Jasmine.

list.title: Burlington Lemonade Stand
list.text: Thirsty? Come by Viewmount Rd in Oakville on Sunday May 15th between 1 and 3pm for some delicious lemonade and cookies!
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words burlington lemonade stand.

list.title: Oakville Refugee Encounter
list.text: In the history of humanity, there have never been as many refugees around the world as we are seeing today. Join us for our 3rd Annual Refugee Encounter to learn more about Tayiba and Elyas’ journey since fleeing their home in Ethiopia. Learn how your donation can support refugees on their journey to a new life. Debit or credit accepted.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words oakville refugee encounter.

list.title: Newmarket Hike for Peace
list.text: Angela is hiking 200km in the next four weeks to raise awareness for Peacemakers.
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Hike for Peace.

list.title: Alliston Peace it together Garage Sale
list.text: Held at PPG Park Pavilion in Alliston. May 29th 10am-2pm (behind the Alliston Fire Hall)
list.imageAlt: Black and yellow graphic with the words Alliston Peace it together Garage Sale.

content.text1: Community is a party and we want to make sure everyone's invited. Ready to connect with people who want to do this together?

image1.alt: Group of friends from church sitting together, and talking.

content.text1: Our care ministries provide safe environments where people can receive the spiritual care they need in safe and intentional community, with trained and caring facilitators.

image1.alt: Two women sitting down together and talking as friends.

content.text1: Peacemakers is our annual campaign in support of peacebuilding efforts through Mennonite Central Committee in the areas of: Indigenous and Settler reconciliation, restorative justice, peacebuilding programs in sub-saharan Africa, and humanitarian relief efforts.

image1.alt: Girl wearing a head covering holding a hand drawn picture of her violent environment.

content.text1: We're a church that exists to grow loving communities of Jesus-followers who live and share his irreligious message. We value community, simplicity, and peace with a mission to share the gospel and care for people. We belong to a denomination called Be In Christ Church of Canada. If you're interested in specific beliefs or positions we hold, check out our denominational doctrinal statement in the link below.
We work together to create a safe community where our kids and youth can learn to love and follow Jesus. We do this through building relationships, and equipping parents.

image1.alt: A young child playing with blocks.

content.text1: We work together to create a safe community where our kids and youth can learn to love and follow Jesus. We do this through building relationships, and equipping parents.

image1.alt: A young child playing with blocks.
A map representing locations of The Meeting House churches.

content.text1: It's pretty simple: we get together to build relationships, and find ways to love and serve our neighbourhoods as we learn to follow Jesus.
content.link1AriaLabel: View a map of all church locations

content.text1: Together, we made peace possible by raising $160,858 for peacebuilding projects through our partner, Mennonite Central Committee.
